docs.lead_paragraph: The most ambitious "repeal and replace" health care plan from a presidential candidate comes from Sen. Bernie Sanders, not from a Republican.

headline.main: What to Know About 'BernieCare,' Sanders' Health Overhaul
headline.print_headline: What to Know About 'BernieCare,' Sanders' Health Overhaul

docs.snippet: The most ambitious "repeal and replace" health care plan from a presidential candidate comes from Sen. Bernie Sanders, not from a Republican.

docs.lead_paragraph: Insurers’ struggles in marketplaces created by the Affordable Care Act have emboldened both conservatives who want to shrink the federal role and liberals who want to expand it.

headline.main: Instability in Marketplaces Draws Concern on Both Sides of Health Law
headline.print_headline: Instability in Marketplaces Draws Concern on Both Sides of Health Law

docs.abstract: Instability in health insurance marketplaces created by Affordable Care Act, including in markets in many states, is providing fodder for arguments of both detractors, who want to shrink federal role in healthcare, and supporters who want to expand it.
docs.snippet: Insurers’ struggles in marketplaces created by the Affordable Care Act have emboldened both conservatives who want to shrink the federal role and liberals who want to expand it.

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject

byline.original: By ROBERT PEAR and ABBY GOODNOUGH

docs.lead_paragraph: The only Southern state to embrace the Affordable Care Act appears headed in a different direction under a new governor, Matt Bevin.

headline.main: Kentucky, Beacon for Health Law, Now a Lab for Its Retreat
headline.print_headline: Kentucky, Beacon for Health Law, Becomes a Lab for Its Retreat

docs.abstract: Kentucky Gov-elect Matt Bevin promises to repeal Pres Obama's Medicaid expansion created by his Democratic predecessor Steven L Beshear; says that expansion as it stands now is unaffordable (Series: Remaking Medicine).
docs.snippet: The only Southern state to embrace the Affordable Care Act appears headed in a different direction under a new governor, Matt Bevin.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Oklahoma hospital that treated about 40 people after a woman driving a vehicle plowed into a crowd at a university homecoming parade last month will not bill the patients for their initial treatment, hospital officials said on Friday.

headline.main: Oklahoma Hospital Will Not Charge Homecoming Crash Victims for ER Treatment
headline.print_headline: Oklahoma Hospital Will Not Charge Homecoming Crash Victims for ER Treatment

docs.snippet: The Oklahoma hospital that treated about 40 people after a woman driving a vehicle plowed into a crowd at a university homecoming parade last month will not bill the patients for their initial treatment, hospital officials said on Friday.

docs.lead_paragraph: An increase in fatalities and injuries has mostly affected undocumented immigrant laborers and far exceeds the rate of new construction.

headline.main: Safety Lapses and Deaths Amid a Building Boom in New York

docs.abstract: Number of workers hurt and killed in construction accidents amid New York City's building boom has soared over past two years, far surpassing rate of construction, and most of those are undocumented immigrant laborers; safety inspectors, government officials and prosecutors contend safety rules at job sites are weak and ineffective.
docs.snippet: An increase in fatalities and injuries has mostly affected undocumented immigrant laborers and far exceeds the rate of new construction.

byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Kim Barker, Veera Kaur, Ken Schwencke and Isvett Verde, and research by Susan C. Beachy.

docs.lead_paragraph: Poultry exported to Europe from factories in Thailand is sometimes prepared in conditions that violate labor rights, two Scandinavian groups promoting corporate responsibility charged Thursday. The claim comes as Thailand's seafood industry is reeling from allegations that its products are tainted by major labor abuses, including slavery on fishing boats.

headline.main: Thai Poultry Producers Accused of Labor Abuses
headline.print_headline: Thai Poultry Producers Accused of Labor Abuses

docs.lead_paragraph: Thousands of Greek pensioners demonstrated in central Athens on Thursday against cuts demanded under an international bailout, and the public sector union called its second nationwide anti-austerity strike in under a month.

headline.main: Greek Pensioners Rally Against Cuts, Workers to Strike on December 3
headline.print_headline: Greek Pensioners Rally Against Cuts, Workers to Strike on December 3

docs.snippet: Thousands of Greek pensioners demonstrated in central Athens on Thursday against cuts demanded under an international bailout, and the public sector union called its second nationwide anti-austerity strike in under a month.

docs.lead_paragraph: Escalating drug prices and now a major company’s pending move overseas leads to concern about “too much obvious greed” in the pharmaceutical industry.

headline.main: Pfizer’s Plan to Leave U.S. Unsettles Drug Lobbyists
headline.print_headline: Pfizer’s Plan to Leave U.S. Unsettles Drug Lobbyists

docs.abstract: Drugmaker Pfizer's decision to merge with Allergan and move its headquarters to Ireland has shaken industry lobbyists, who see potential to damage industry and create backlash against it; Obama administration and both Republican and Democratic members of Congress have pressed for tax-code reform that would prohibit practice, known as 'corporate inversion,' that allows companies to pay foreign taxes rather than higher American rates.
docs.snippet: Escalating drug prices and now a major company’s pending move overseas leads to concern about “too much obvious greed” in the pharmaceutical industry.

docs.lead_paragraph: Bernie Sanders, who in the 1980s was mayor of Vermont’s largest city, Burlington, tended to talk globally but act locally, aligning with Republicans to get things done.

headline.main: As Mayor, Bernie Sanders Was More Pragmatist Than Socialist
headline.print_headline: As a Mayor, Sanders Favored Pragmatism Over His Idealism

docs.abstract: Self-described socialist Bernie Sanders is seen by many as wildly idealistic, but his actions and accomplishments as mayor of Burlington, VT, in 1980s indicate high degree of pragmatism; achieved goals of revitalizing city while stemming gentrification by prioritizing immediate needs of community and collaborating across ideological lines.
docs.snippet: Bernie Sanders, who in the 1980s was mayor of Vermont’s largest city, Burlington, tended to talk globally but act locally, aligning with Republicans to get things done.
